target_text: there was a girl named Emma. Every day she would follow her mother around the house. Everywhere her mother went, Emma was right behind her. One day, Emma and her mother were in the kitchen, and Emma saw a knob that she really wanted to touch. She asked her mother if she could turn it, and her mother said yes. As soon as Emma turned the knob, the kitchen filled with light! Emma's mother was so happy and said, "Well done Emma! You found the light switch. Now it is easier to see in the kitchen." Emma felt so proud of herself and smiled from ear to ear. That day, her mom bought her a special treat for being so brave and following directions - a spoiled ice cream cone. Emma was so happy and gobbled it up with a smile!

alert bear was very excited. He was ready to go on an adventure. He started running through the forest at a very fast speed. He dodged trees and hopped over fallen logs. Suddenly, he saw a pile of junk in the middle of the path. He was so alert that he quickly stopped running. He was not sure what the junk was, but he knew he had to get around it. He quickly made his way around it and was soon on his way again. He continued running as fast as he could. It was so much fun! Soon he reached his destination. It was a wonderful adventure that he would never forget.

upon a time, there was a clumsy boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat popcorn while watching his favorite movie. One day, Timmy's mom bought him a big bag of popcorn. Timmy was so happy and started to eat it right away. While watching the movie, Timmy accidentally spilled the popcorn all over the floor. He tried to clean it up, but he was too clumsy. Suddenly, the doorbell rang. Timmy's friends came over to watch the movie with him. Timmy was embarrassed about the mess, but he tried to hide it. As they watched the movie, Timmy's friends started to slip and fall on the popcorn. They were hurt and had to go home early. Timmy felt terrible and tried to reveal what had happened, but it was too late. His friends were already gone, and he was left alone with the mess. Timmy learned that it's always best to tell the truth and not try to hide your mistakes.

andy loved life. She was always so happy and clumsy. One day, Mandy was so tired from playing around all day that she decided to go and rest. She went to the park and lay down in the grass. Mandy felt so relaxed and fell asleep. The sun shone down and made her sleepy. When Mandy woke up, she felt so much better. She had rested so much that she was ready to go and play again. She ran around the park and played with her friends. She even held a race with her little brother. Mandy realized how special life can be when you take time to rest. She always tried to remember to rest so that she had enough energy to keep playing and having fun. Thanks to her rest, Mandy had the energy she needed to enjoy life and be the clumsy, happy person she was.

there was a little ant who was feeling very brave. He wanted to go on a great adventure, so he headed outside. As he was walking, he noticed a fierce bear. The ant froze when he saw the bear, and the bear saw the ant too. The ant asked the bear, "Why are you so fierce?". The bear replied, "I'm fierce because I'm looking for a brave friend to help me on my journey. If you are brave enough to help me, I will be very grateful". The ant thought about this and decided that he would help the bear on his journey. The two of them travelled together and had a lot of fun. The ant soon learned that the bear was not so fierce after all. The ant was glad that he was brave enough to help the bear and they both discovered a new adventure together.

upon a time, there was a little child named Timmy. Timmy was very charming and loved to play with his toys. One day, Timmy fell and hurt his knee. He cried and cried because it hurt so much. Timmy's mom took him to the doctor, who put a band-aid on his knee. The band-aid helped to heal Timmy's boo-boo. Soon, Timmy was feeling much better and was able to play with his toys again. From that day on, Timmy made sure to be careful when he played so he wouldn't get hurt again. And if he did get a boo-boo, he knew that his mom and the doctor would be there to help him heal.

Mommy! Look!" shouted Benny excitedly, holding up a plush toy. It was old, with a soft velvet touch. His mom smiled. "It's lovely," she said. Benny stared at it, shaking it gently from side to side. "I'm going to take good care of it," he said quietly. His mom touched his shoulder. "I'm sure you will," she said. A few weeks later, Benny was playing with his toy in the garden when a gust of wind blew it onto the grass. He rushed over to pick it up. To his surprise, the toy shook in his hands. Benny shook it some more, and soon heard a faint sound coming from inside. His mom, who had been working in the garden, came over with a curious look on her face. "What have you found?" she asked. Benny grinned. "It's a surprise!" he said, shaking the velvet toy harder. Suddenly, a little bird fluttered out of the toy and flew away into the sky. Benny and his mom watched in awe, smiling. "You never know what you'll find," said his mom with a wink.

there was a little girl who loved to admire other people. She would look from afar and see what they were doing and how they acted. One day she saw a model. The model was walking with purpose and grace. The little girl was mesmerized and couldn't stop staring. The model noticed the little girl and smiled. She asked the little girl why she was staring and the little girl explained that she wanted to be like the model. The model was very kind and said she could be just like her if she was patient and worked hard. The little girl wanted to be like the model so badly. She began practicing every day. Some days she wanted to give up and quit, but she kept going and was very stubborn. With persistence and hard work she eventually learned how to be graceful like the model. The little girl's friends and family were amazed at how she changed. She kept admiring the model and learned such great lessons. Thanks to her stubbornness, she really did become like the model and inspired others around her.

upon a time there was a strong mouse. He loved to jog around his house. One day, he decided to ask his friend, the fly, to jog with him. Mouse said, "Fly, let's jog together." Fly said, "Yes, I love to jog." So both the mouse and the fly went jogging together. They ran around the house, over the couch, and under the table. They were having lots of fun. Suddenly, they heard a loud meow. There, on the window sill was a friendly cat. Cat said, "Can I join you?" Mouse replied, "Yes, of course! We would love to have you join us." So the three of them jogged together. Around and around the house they ran. The mouse, the fly and the cat were so happy to be able to jog together. And so they lived happily ever after.

upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved animals and he went to the zoo with his mommy. They walked around and saw many animals, but Timmy's favorite was the zebra. He recognized it because it had black and white stripes. Suddenly, Timmy's tummy started to grumble. "Mommy, I'm hungry," he said. "Can we get something tasty to eat?" Mommy took him to the snack bar and they got some crackers. Timmy took a bite and said, "Mmm, these crackers are tasty!" As they walked back to see the animals, they heard a loud roar. "What's that?" Timmy asked. "That's a lion," Mommy said. "But don't worry, we're safe behind this fence." Timmy looked at the lion and said, "Wow, he's big and scary!" They continued to walk around the zoo, looking at all the animals until it was time to go home.

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to go outside and play in the park. One day, she found a pebble on the ground. It was very ugly and had bumps all over it. Lily picked up the pebble and looked at it closely. She didn't like how it looked but she decided to keep it anyway. She put the pebble in her pocket and continued to play. Later that day, Lily showed the pebble to her mom. Her mom thought it was very pretty and shiny. Lily didn't understand why her mom thought that because she thought it was ugly. But her mom explained that sometimes things that look ugly to one person can look beautiful to another. From that day on, Lily started to see things differently and learned to appreciate the beauty in everything.

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the park with her friends. One day, Lily's mom told her they were going to visit her grandma. Lily was excited because she loved her grandma's house. When they arrived, Lily saw a big box in the living room. Her grandma told her it was a surprise for her. Lily was so curious and couldn't wait to see what was inside. After dinner, her grandma finally let her open the box. Inside, there was a soft teddy bear that Lily could rub and cuddle with. She was so happy and gave her grandma a big hug. The next day, Lily's friends came over to play. She showed them her new teddy bear and they all played together. One of her friends accidentally knocked the teddy bear over and it got a little dirty. Lily got upset and called her friend stupid. But then she remembered how happy she was when she first saw the teddy bear and how much her grandma loved her. She apologized to her friend and they all continued to play happily.

arry was eating his breakfast when he saw a cop. He was very thin and had a shiny badge. Harry was scared so he grabbed his dad's hand. His dad said, "Don't worry, he's here to help." The cop said, "I need to examine your house." Harry was still scared but his dad agreed. The cop went to every room and looked around. He peered behind curtains and opened cupboards. He even looked under beds. He examined everything carefully. When the cop was finished he thanked Harry and his dad and left. His dad told Harry that the cop was looking for something that had gone missing. Harry was relieved. He enjoyed watching the cop examine the house and was glad that he was here to help.

there was a small boy named Tim. He was always curious, and wanted to explore the world around him. One day, he decided to go for a walk in the woods near his home. He set off with a wide smile and a hop in his step. As he walked deeper into the woods, he heard a strange noise. He stopped, looked around and yelled, "Who's there?". Suddenly, a thick mist began to fill the woods. Tim was frightened and started to run, but the mist was too thick. It was difficult to see, and Tim stumbled and fell. He tried to get up, but the mist was getting thicker. He kept yelling and yelling, but no one answered. Eventually, the mist started to clear. Tim looked around, but he was all alone. He looked up to the sky and it was fair. Tim was scared and began to cry. He knew he had been lost for a very long time. He yelled one last time, but went unheard. He was alone and lost in the woods, never to be seen again.

upon a time, there was a little white boat floating on the lake. The sun sparkled on the water, and the boat glided along. Suddenly, the boat stopped and the little engine sputtered out some steam. The steam was so white, it seemed like clouds were flowing from the boat. Out of the steam came a tall man. He waved his hands, and asked the boat, "What are you doing resting here?" The boat said nothing. The man smiled and said, "Come on, let's keep going. I'm sure it will be a nice trip". The boat hummed, and the engine started again. The man waved goodbye and the boat sailed away, leaving a white cloud of steam behind it. The man had been glad to help the little white boat and show it the way. Now the boat was off to explore the world!

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to swing at the park every day. She would go up and down, back and forth, feeling the wind in her hair. One day, Lily's swing broke and she was very sad. But her dad said he would fix it right away. After a little while, Lily's dad came back with the swing all fixed up. Lily was so happy and thanked her dad. She got on the swing and went higher and higher. She felt fine and happy again. Lily's dad watched her swing and smiled. He was happy to see his little girl having fun. From that day on, Lily made sure to swing every day, and her dad made sure to check it was safe. Lily knew that swinging was her favorite way to play and it always made her feel fine.

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park with her mommy. While playing, she felt very tired and wanted to sleep. So, her mommy took her back home and put her in bed. As she was sleeping, she heard a knock on the door. Her mommy went to answer it and there was a stranger at the door. The stranger said he was lost and needed help. Lily's mommy felt sorry for the stranger and decided to help him. She gave him some water and bread to eat. The stranger was very thankful and left soon after. After the stranger left, Lily's mommy told her that sometimes it's hard to know who to trust. But she was glad she could help someone who needed it. And with that, Lily went back to sleep.

there was a little girl, and she was three years old. She was very excited, because she was about to buy her very own telephone. On the way to the store she saw a big blue telephone in a window. It was the most beautiful thing she had ever seen. The little girl wanted that phone so much, she almost started to cry. She asked her mom, "Can I buy the blue telephone?" But her mom said, "No, sweetie, it's too expensive." The little girl was very disappointed, but she didn't give up. She begged, "Please can I buy it? Please, please, please?" Finally her mom said, "Okay, since it's so beautiful, I guess it would be alright." The little girl was ecstatic. She screamed with joy and ran off to buy the blue telephone. It was the best day of her life!

and Lily were twins who liked to play in the garden. They had a big tree with a ladder that they could climb up and down. One day, they saw a bird's nest on a branch. They wanted to see the eggs inside. "Let's go up the ladder and look at the nest," Tom said. "OK, but be careful," Lily said. They climbed up the ladder and reached the branch. They saw the nest with four blue eggs. They were very happy. "Wow, look at the eggs! They are so pretty!" Lily said. "Can we touch them?" Tom asked. "No, we can't. They belong to the bird. We should leave them alone," Lily said. But Tom did not listen. He reached out his hand and touched one of the eggs. He felt something move inside. He was curious. He picked up the egg and held it in his palm. "Tom, don't do that! Put it back!" Lily said. But it was too late. The egg cracked and a baby bird came out. It was wet and scared. It peeped loudly. "Oops, I broke the egg!" Tom said. Suddenly, they heard a loud squawk. It was the mother bird. She saw Tom holding her baby. She was very angry. She flew towards them and attacked them with her beak and claws. "Help! Help! The bird is mad!" Tom and Lily screamed. They tried to escape, but they were too high. They could not go down the ladder fast enough. The bird kept pecking and sc

am likes to sing. He sings all the songs he knows. He sings in the morning, he sings at lunch, he sings at night. He has a fan that makes him cool when he sings. He also has a toy that can record his voice. He calls it his mic. One day, Sam decides to record his best song. He holds his mic and sings very loud and clear. He sings about his fan, his toys, his mom and dad. He sings for a long time. He is very happy. When he is done, he presses a button on his mic. He hears his voice coming out of the mic. He smiles. He likes how he sounds. He wants to share his song with someone. He runs to his mom and dad. They are in the kitchen. He says, "Mom, dad, listen to me! I recorded my song!" He gives them his mic and presses the button. Mom and dad listen to Sam's song. They hear him sing about his fan, his toys, his mom and dad. They hear him sing for a long time. They are very proud of him. They clap and hug him. They say, "Sam, you are a great singer! Your song is very sweet. We love you!" Sam is very happy. He loves his mom and dad. He loves his fan and his mic. He loves to sing.

upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, Lily's friend Timmy asked her to come over and play with his new equipment. Lily was excited and said yes. When Lily got to Timmy's house, he showed her his new bike. Lily wanted to try it, but she was very clumsy and fell off the bike. Timmy laughed and said, "You are so clumsy!" Lily felt embarrassed and sad. She went home and didn't want to play with Timmy anymore. The next day, Timmy came to Lily's house and asked her to come play again. But Lily didn't want to play with him anymore and said no. Timmy felt sad and went home. He didn't invite Lily to play again. Lily realized that she was mean to Timmy and regretted it. She wished she could go back and be friends with him again, but it was too late.

upon a time there was a sunny day in the forest. A boy heard a loud sound and he followed it. When he came to the edge of the forest he saw a big stream. He saw the loud noise was the stream gushing and bubbling. He wanted to add to the noise and went to the stream's edge. He put a few rocks into the stream. The stream made a louder sound and the boy laughed and laughed. He put more and more rocks into the stream, and it only got louder. Soon all the animals were joining in and adding to the noise. The boy kept adding and adding rocks until the stream was really, really loud. The boy was very happy and kept adding rocks. The end.

there was a slow hose. It wasn't like any other hose. It was very special. Every day it would take the children to the park. It snaked its way around the garden leaving a trail of joy everywhere it went. The children used it to water the garden and to make mud pies! But one day something strange happened. The hose was gone! The children searched high and low for it but couldn't find it. They were so sad and wondered what had happened. Then one day, the slow hose was found! It had got stuck in the garden wall. The children remembered how much they had enjoyed their time playing with the hose and were so happy to have it back. From that day on the slow hose was never lost again, and the children remembered to look after it!

day there was a spoilt gorilla. He was naughty and he didn't listen to anyone. He was always doing things that he shouldn't. One day he saw a big fire and he wanted to play with it. So he came close and he tried to touch it but it was hot! It burned him and he screamed. The gorilla got scared and he ran away. Now he knew that he shouldn't go near the fire or he would get hurt. It was important to be careful. From that day the gorilla was very careful. He didn't touch the fire again and he learnt his lesson!

upon a time, there was a little girl called Lily. Lily loved islands and every day she dreamed about visiting one of her own. One day, Lily heard an exciting announcement. Her parents invited her to go to an island for the weekend. Lily was so happy that she jumped up and down. The family was soon on the boat to the island. As they arrived, they heard the noisy sound of the birds singing and the waves breaking against the shore. It was beautiful. Lily played on the beach all day long. She collected shells and made sandcastles. When it was time to leave, Lily said goodbye to the island and promised to come back again. She couldn't wait for her parents to invite her back.

day, Tom went for a walk in the park. He saw a large lumber appear from far away. It was very flexible and Tom wanted to explore it. He touched the lumber and it moved left and right. He had so much fun! He ran around it, jumped over it, and crawled under it. He spent the whole day playing with the flexible lumber. After a while, Tom's mother called him over for dinner. But the next day, when Tom came back, the lumber had disappeared.

upon a time, there was a tiny coal, glimmering in the sun. It was modest in size, but it was full of potential. Every day, the coal grew bigger and brighter, until one day it was so big and hot it was glowing! The little coal shone with a brilliant light, warming up everything around it. Everyone was so happy to see the coal's warm light, and animals started to gather around the coal. The coal was so pleased with the attention, and it continued to grow. It became bigger, brighter, and warmer than ever before. Eventually the little coal's light filled the sky, and it was so much brighter than the sun. Everyone was happy to be warmed by the coal's light and love. Just as the coal had grown, so had the happiness of everyone in the land.

upon a time, there was a lovely garden with many different herbs in it. A girl loved to go and play in the garden. She would whisper sweet things to the herbs, like “grow tall and strong” and “be healthy and happy”. She truly believed that the herbs would listen. Soon, one of her favorite herbs in the garden began to do something amazing. It started to grow much bigger and much faster than before! The girl was so excited. She kept on whispering sweet things to the herb. Finally, the herb was successful! It grew so tall and strong that, from the girl’s perspective, it nearly reached the sky. She happily whispered to it one last time, “Thank you for listening.”

upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a vest that he loved to wear every day. It was blue and had lots of pockets. Timmy's friend, Billy, saw the vest and felt envious. He wanted a vest just like Timmy's. One day, Timmy and Billy were playing outside when it started to rain. Timmy remembered that he had left his window open in his room. He told Billy that he needed to go inside and close the window. Billy asked if he could come with him to see Timmy's vest again. When they got inside, Timmy closed the window and showed Billy his vest. Billy was even more envious than before. Timmy told Billy that he could borrow the vest if he wanted to. Billy was so happy and put on the vest right away. They played inside for the rest of the day, both wearing the blue vest.

upon a time there was a rich desk. It was made of special wood and it looked very nice. Everyone wanted to have a desk just like this one. One day, a boy called Tim went to see the desk. He wanted to restore it and make it even nicer. He worked for a long time, cleaning and polishing the wood. When he was done, the desk looked beautiful and very rich. Everyone who saw it was very happy and thanked Tim for restoring the desk. Now it was perfect and the boy was very proud of his work. He had done a good job restoring the rich desk.

, a little girl and her mom were walking near a big mountain. The sunny day was perfect for a walk. The mom asked her little girl to keep her shoes on and mind her steps, but the little girl was feeling frustrated. She wanted to take them off and feel the grass beneath her toes. The little girl sighed and asked "Why do I have to mind my steps? The grass is so soft, I would just love to play in it for a bit!" Her mom smiled and said, "I know that playing in the grass sounds like fun, but sometimes it's important to mind the things I tell you. If you take your shoes off, you won't be able to climb the mountain." The little girl was amazed. She hadn't seen the mountain before! She thought climbing it would be so much fun. She smiled and said, "Okay, mom. I'll mind my steps and keep my shoes on." The little girl had a lot of fun on her walk and was so proud that she had minded her mom's instructions. Climbing the mountain was now something she looked forward to doing one day.

there were two friends, Annie and Beth. They were playing in the park with some hoops. Annie wanted to play with them but Beth shook her head and said she didn't know how. Annie shrugged, she wanted to help but knew that Beth didn't want that. Suddenly, a hoop came rolling into the park. It was big and round, just like the others. Beth was excited! She picked up the hoop and asked Annie to show her how to play. Annie smiled and grabbed the hoop. She showed Beth how to swing it around, and soon Beth was having lots of fun. Annie was happy that Beth was having a good time, and that she was able to help her. As Beth was getting better at playing with the hoops, Annie looked around the park. She saw that there were more hoops available and even some other things like jump ropes. Annie smiled. She was happy that she could share the fun with Beth.
